direction.raw_text: once. I think it was your farewell bout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tonight marks Spinner Dunn's final appearance in the ring. What a pleasure it's been to watch him proudly march into the record books for taking more blows to the head than any fighter in history. A bloodied, defeated Spinner happily holds up the arm of his opponent after a match. He then hugs the referee. He jumps down from the ring and hugs the three judges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scrambled a bit? Sure. You don't retire with a record of 81-59 and wind up the Governor. But on the upside, he's got the disposition of a collie. Spinner wades into the stands and starts hugging the spectators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I love, Smoochy? I love when you do the Jiggy Ziggy dance! You know, the one you do during 'Silly Time?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet.     That's a big one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna see me do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I don't know why if there's enough room here to... Spinner starts Jiggying and Ziggying for Sheldon. He bangs into a table and knocks over someone's drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, champ, don't get overheated. Spinner stops, out of breath.       He leans over and hugs Sheldon. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... uh... love you, too, Spinner. A powerful-looking woman, TOMMY COTTER, calls to Spinner from the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spinner, come over and meet the Senator! Spinner dutifully hurries over to Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seems pretty popular. It must take real talent to run a place like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spinner? The guy couldn't run a water faucet. He's just a mascot. It's his cousins, a bunch of Irish mob boys, who really run the joint. ANGLE ON SPINNER He shakes the Senator's hand as Tommy and a few other tough Irish guys stand around. Spinner looks over towards Sheldon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (loudly) Don't go anywhere, Smoochy! I'll be right back after I take a dump! Spinner releases the Senator's hand and rushes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you made a new friend, kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ANGELO PIKE'S RUNDOWN APARTMENT (LOWER EAST SIDE) - NIGHT We met him backstage with Smoochy... innocent face... Angelo stirs a pot of soup in the worn-down but tidy apartment. A "Rhinette" costume is draped over one of the chairs. There is a sudden LOUD POUNDING on the door. Angelo puts the spoon down and reaches behind some spices on the shelf above. He pulls out a revolver. The POUNDING continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (friendly) Open up, buddy! It's me, Randolph! It's been a long time! Angelo puts the gun in his waistband and walks to the door. He slowly slides the chain off and opens the door a crack. Peering in at him are the bloodshot eyes of Rainbow Randolph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Randy? Randolph suddenly kicks the door open and tackles Angelo. Randolph sits on top of the little man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fucking traitor! My body's barely cold and already you work for the rhino?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't lie to me! I heard all about it! You strapped that horn on faster than a cheerleader gets the clap!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta eat, don't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a Krinkle Kid!   Not a Smooch-bag! Say it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhinette! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it: I am a Krinkle Kid! Say it, before God! On the soul of Jesus Christ! Say what you are! Angelo punches Randolph in the mouth and flips him over. He now sits on Randolph, pointing the revolver to his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a Rhinette. Got that? The Krinkle Kids are ten feet under. With you. Randolph starts crying like a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blubbering) I missed you so much. Can I stay here? I got no place to go. Angelo sighs and puts the gun away. INT. ANGELO'S APARTMENT - SHORT WHILE LATER Angelo and Randolph sit at the small kitchen table. Angelo watches as Randolph ravenously eats a bowl of soup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... They kicked me out of the corporate penthouse. Big surprise. Sons-a-bitches. That's how I got this beauty. He points to a nasty bump near his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And of course, there's this... He yanks his lip back to reveal a missing tooth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That happened after my little visit to the studio the other day. Network security. Fucking savages. He slurps another spoonful of soup and spits a bay leaf on the floor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got liens, back taxes, lawyer's bills, threats against my life... I basically got the whole fucking world up my ass. It's okay, I got a loooong memory, son. (Amos and Andy dialect) What dey sow, dey gonna reap. He cackles insanely as he picks up a bottle of gin and takes a deep swig. He passes out and falls off the chair. Angelo leans down and lifts his head off the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop doing this to yourself! Randolph doesn't respond.    Angelo slaps his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wise up! You hear me? Don't piss your life away like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (half-conscious) It's the rhino, Angie. He's been sent by the devil. Sent from hell to destroy me. Smoochy... is the face of evil. EXT. BROADWAY (TIMES SQUARE) - MORNING We are ON the smiling goofy face of Sheldon, whose picture graces the front page of Variety under the headline, "MOPES TO EXECUTIVE PRODUCE SMOOCHY SHOW." The subhead reads, "TENURE TO BEGIN TODAY." A dollar bill is slapped down over the picture. We WIDEN OUT to see Sheldon buying the magazine at the newsstand in front of the Kidnet Building. He turns and walks toward the Kidnet entrance. He stops and looks up at the building. Smiling, he takes a deep breath and enters. INT. KIDNET HALLWAY - FEW MOMENTS LATER Sheldon whistles as he walks down the hall, giving cheerful "hellos" and "good mornings" along the way.   He enters Nora's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. NORA'S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS ACTION Nora is on the phone. She pretends not to notice him. Sheldon bides his time by inspecting knickknacks, examining photos on the wall, etc. Finally, he half- whispers/half-mouths to her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whenever you get a chance... I just need a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) Listen, can I call you back? Yeah, some asshole's screaming in my ear. Thanks. She hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, you didn't have to hang up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I didn't you'd still be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I am still here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm hoping to correct that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nora, I want us to start off on the right foot. I want you to know that I value your input and I don't want you to feel intimidated just because the power structure has changed a bit. I consider you a partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. That'll come in handy if we're ever at a square dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I was never much of the do- se-do type, but what I would love to do is take you out to lunch one day. You know, just two colleagues chewing the fat... forming a mutual respect... planting the seeds of cooperation... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fair enough. If you change your mind -- NORA I won't. Sheldon just nods and starts to exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay then, I'll be in my office if you need me. If you want to brainstorm about anything. Ideas and so forth. He passes a plant by the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ficus? She ignores him.      He exits. INT. HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS ACTION Sheldon walks slowly down the hallway.     He no longer has a bounce in his step. INT. SHELDON'S NEW OFFICE - MOMENT LATER Sheldon enters his plush new office, awkwardly walks over to his new desk and sits behind it for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My cousin Spinner's take quite a shine to you. Sheldon jumps. He's surprised to Tommy from Spinner Dunn's restaurant. Tommy's crew, ROY, DANNY, JIMMY and SAMMY occupy the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever since you came in the restaurant. He can't stop yakkin'. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's a very nice man. Very sweet disposition for someone that size.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I was wondering if maybe you could give him a little floor space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, a little part on the show. You're the executive producer now. You call the shots, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, that's a very sweet offer, and I love Spinner, but TV is a complicated medium and... I mean, that would be like me getting into the ring with a prizefighter. (laughs) Can you imagine such a thing? Boom. K.O.! What's the alphabet, Mommy? Sheldon laughs again.       Tommy gets quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This makes me sad.    Very, very, sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, Tommy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.     I'm just very sad right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who made you sad, Tommy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to mention names. The guys look menacingly at Sheldon. They rise and walk around his desk until they're on either side of him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? Maybe I can find Spinner a little something to do on the show. That's probably the best solution. Tommy now smiles and walks over to Sheldon.       She musses Sheldon's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a good boy, Mopes. Don't think we don't remember favors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I appreciate the visit, but I'm just putting together a little petting zoo segment. Nothing fancy -- a few kittens... maybe a duck... ANGLE ON SONNY SUPERIMPOSE:    SONNY GORDON, PRESIDENT, ANIMAL WRANGLERS' LOCAL 358 SONNY If you're looking to bring in that many pieces I gotta put a crew together. Plus, we're lookin' at transpo, a few leash handlers, a cleanup boy and a doper to keep the inventory quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez, this all sounds awfully elaborate. I might have to forgo the union and just borrow a few animals from a pet shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't recommend it. Miss Carol from Romper Room tried that once and she's still limping. SWISH PAN TO -- 42. INT. SHELDON'S OFFICE - SHORT TIME LATER A frazzled-looking Sheldon is meeting with BEN FRANKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On behalf of FunZone Toys, I'd like to congratulate you on your recent promotion, and present you with a small gift. SUPERIMPOSE:   BEN FRANKS, V.P., FUNZONE TOYS Ben reaches into his breast pocket and drops a large wad of money on Sheldon's desk that lands with a thud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... that's nice of you, Ben, but a card would have been fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FunZone Toys would very much like the Smoochy contract, Mr. Mopes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this... I mean... are you offering me a bribe or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FunZone Toys would very much like the Smoochy contract, Mr. Mopes. Sheldon picks up the money and tosses it back to Ben. Sheldon rises from his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Normally, sir, we take the trash out at the end of the day, but I think I'll make an exception in your case. Sheldon escorts Ben out the door and slams it shut.   The PHONE RINGS. Sheldon walks over and picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) A Mr. Feedlepepper on line two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) He says he's an old friend. Sheldon punches line two. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? INTERCUT: INT. ANGELO'S APARTMENT - RANDOLPH RANDOLPH (V.O.) You better grow eyes on the back of your fucking head, you horned piece of shit! I won't sleep until the worms are crawlin' up your foam rubber ass! I'm going on safari, motherfucker... safari! Sheldon hangs up stunned.       Nora walks in holding the daily news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations on your little ice show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It didn't take you long to sell out, did it? She tosses the paper on his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to your precious integrity? Or was that just part of your dog and pony act. She exits.    A confused Sheldon looks at the "Around Town" column. INSERT - HEADLINE "GARDEN TO HOST SMOOCHY ON ICE."      The subhead reads: "HUGE GATE EXPECTED -- VENDORS SALIVATE AT SMELL OF BIG BUCKS."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SPINNER DUNN'S - EVENING We are TIGHT ON the feet of an Irish dancer doing a sort of Riverdance. We WIDEN OUT and the rest of the dancers come INTO FRAME. Spinner and the mob ar clapping and whooping. Sheldon and Burke sit at a table in the dark club having a conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burke, I never agreed to do an ice show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shel, do you know what kind of cash we'll take in between the gate and concessions? A venture like this gets you money and muscle. Times twenty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ice shows represent everything I'm against. They're mindless spectacles whose main purpose is to sell overpriced sugar-water and cheap plastic toys that splinter in a kid's mouth on the ride home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I know you got this fetish for ethics, but now's not the time to fly that kite. No one's ever refused a shot at an ice show. Sheldon tears the contract in half.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until now. Smoochy doesn't sell out, Burke. You should be proud of that. Proud that you represent a client who paves driveways, not paints them over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thrilled, Shel. Knocked out. Burke just sits there, stunned.   A waitress, SANDY, passes by the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have a pineapple juice, Sandy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pineapple? What happened to orange juice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm feeling feisty tonight. INT. TELEVISION STUDIO - DAY We are now on a drum solo. Ernie the Elephant of the Smoochyland Band works it. The animal band plays a sloppy version of "Pop Goes the Weasel." End on Spinner Dunn -- the newest and by far largest member of the band. Spinner holds s cowbell and seems to be concentrating intently on the proper moment to hit it. Unfortunately, his rhythm is off, which throws the rest of the band off as well. We WIDEN OUT to see Smoochy and the Rhinettes attempting to dance to the off-kilter rhythm. The song finally ends. The Rhinettes glare at Spinner. Smoochy addresses the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, wasn't that fun? In an awkward kind of way? Anyhoo, how 'bout a big round of applause for the newest member of the Smoochyland Band... former heavyweight contender, Spinner Dunn! Spinner stands up to take a bow and almost knocks the entire bandstand over. There is a smattering of confused applause from the kids in the bleachers. Spinner drops the cowbell and it clangs on the studio floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.   Sorry. INT. BACKSTAGE - AFTER SHOW A beaming Spinner runs up to Sheldon, who's still in costume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I do good, Sheldon, huh?   Did I do good? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that was great, Spinner. Just watch your elbow next time. Pinky's probably gonna lose that tooth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okey doke.   I'm gonna go get drunk now. Spinner skips off humming "Pop Goes the Weasel" and banging his cowbell. Nora passes Sheldon backstage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice job. Casting the show with mental patients, I like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is not a mental patient. He's an ex-boxer and nightclub owner who happens to have the sweet innocent brian of a five-year-old!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me for not making the distinction. She leaves. EXT. BROADWAY (TIMES SQUARE) - NIGHT Sheldon exits the Kidnet building and walks to the curb to hail a cab. A friendly-looking man in a suit and bow tie approaches him. This is MERV GREEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. A limo pulls up in front of them.     Merv opens the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks anyway, but I'm going uptown. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Merv pulls his jacket back to reveal a revolver tucked in his waistband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Humor me, rhino. INT. LIMOUSINE - CONTINUOUS ACTION Sheldon slides into the back seat of the limo. A big thug in an overcoat, HENRY, is already sitting there. Merv gets in behind him and shuts the door. Sheldon is now wedged between the two men as the limo heads down Broadway. Merv extends his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merv Green, Sheldon. It's a pleasure to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're hoping for an autograph, the gun's a bit much. The whole 'catch more flies with honey' thing -- it really holds water. Sheldon laughs nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheldon, I represent the Parade of Hope Foundation. Maybe you've heard of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You raise money to build children's hospitals, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been known to add a brick or two, sure. Merv and the thug laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheldon, let me get right to the point -- there's talk on the street that you're pulling out of the ice show. Is that true? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I never agreed to an ice show, nor would I ever agree to do an ice show, and let me add that none of this is your concern, sir. (shakes his head) Sheesh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen carefully, son: Parade of Hope has sponsored every Kidnet ice show since 1964. We take a piece off the top and everybody walks away happy. So let's not buck history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I appreciate the offer, but for the gazillionth time, I'm not doing an ice show, so we have nothing to discuss. Now, if you'll just pull over, I'll get out and we'll say our toodley-dos. (to driver) Far corner, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allow me to be less murky. Starting tomorrow, Smoochy the Rhino raises his baton for Parade of Hope. Benefits, banquets, fund-raisers, I want it all. (to driver) Pull over, Terry. The car pulls to the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And as far as the ice show goes... I recommend you start shopping for skates. The door pops open and Sheldon is tossed out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CORPORATE PENTHOUSE - NIGHT A troubled-looking Sheldon stands on his balcony looking out at the city. He drinks orange juice straight from the carton. Sheldon is on the phone with Burke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is unacceptable, Burke!    I'm calling the authorities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Don't do it, Shel. You rat on Parade of Hope and you'll be lucky if they find your toenails. These guys are the roughest of all the charities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was threatened by an organization that's supposed to help children! What kind of world is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The real one. My advice? Consider the ice show and stay healthy. Burke hangs up. After a beat, Sheldon's DOORBELL RINGS. He walks over to the door and opens it. To his surprise, Nora is standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Nora enters. She seems a little wobbly.    Sheldon notices she's holding a pint of whiskey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting drunk and I'm not used to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Well, not to make you feel worse, but with alcohol you're also consuming empty calories. Nora looks at him for a moment. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just that... I want to apologize, actually. And on those rare occasions when I feel the need to apologize for something, it helps if I'm, you know... shit- faced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.   I'm honored. Nora trips slightly.     Sheldon takes the whiskey from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't we get some air? He leads her out on the balcony.    They look out at the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I may have been a little harsh when we spoke the other day. A little out of line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it wasn't as bad as the week before when you called me a pasty- faced, no-talent hack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that was probably insensitive as well. (looks at him) I heard you're not doing the ice show. I find that... incredibly admirable. Why didn't you tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I didn't want to spoil your fun. You look so content when you're berating me. Nora looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid I have become a bit hardened over the years. Sincerity's an easy disguise in this business. It's hard to know who's on the level. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, I'm learning that more and more every day. (wistfully) 'Sometimes light is really dark, Sometimes crows can sing like larks Sometimes Winter feels like Spring, Don't think you know everything.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in disbelief) 'Rickets the Hippo'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember Rickets?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was my favorite show when I was a kid. Rickets was the one face I knew I could trust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how I felt! Rickets had real depth. He was my inspiration for Smoochy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? He was my inspiration to work in children's television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe it. I never met anyone who even remembers Rickets. Do you remember the Klunky-Wunky dance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember it?   I did it at my first communion. Sheldon starts doing the rather insane-looking Klunky- Wunky dance. Nora does it with him. They both stop and look at each other. Sheldon impulsively leans in and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. That was a mistake, right? I didn't mean for that to hap-- Nora grabs his head and pulls it toward her.       They begin kissing passionately. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as they kiss) You're not full of shit like all the others, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as they kiss) You're for real, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (through the kisses) I mean, I couldn't tell... First I thought it was an act... and then I just thought you were a simp or something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh... you don't have to explain... They continue to kiss.      Nora abruptly stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Nora exits the balcony and collects her coat and purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong? Is it the whiskey? If you have to throw up, be my guest. Anywhere you like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just getting late. Sheldon follows her to the door. She stops and looks at him for a moment. The PHONE starts to RING. Neither of them says anything for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better get that.    Good night. She exits. Sheldon shuts the door and sighs. He goes to the bar to pour himself another orange juice before picking up the phone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? ANGELO'S APARTMENT We GO TO a HORIZONTAL SPLIT-SCREEN. Randolph is on the BOTTOM HALF. He lies on his bed in Angelo's apartment wearing a bathrobe with a towel wrapped around his head. His head dangles off the bed as he talks on the phone. The SHOT is reminiscent of Bye Bye Birdie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mr. Mopes? My name is Benjamin Kunklepeck and I'm calling on behalf of 'Parents for Decency in Children's Television,' perhaps you've heard of us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but I like where you're coming from. It's an issue very close to my heart. Why just yesterday I was commenting -- RANDOLPH Sir, we're having a banquet tomorrow and we'd be honored to have you perform for us. direction.raw_text: But here's the really good news: I'm doing it myself. No sponsors, no vendors, no crooks. Not one dirty hand will touch this. Not one person will make a dollar off these kids. Smoochy on Ice will be a study in purity. Burke's grin suddenly fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As far as food concessions go, I'll supply the refreshments. For free. Low sodium, whole wheat pretzels and apple slices. Healthy stuff. Now are you ready for the best part?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm holding my breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All profits from ticket sales will be used to built a state-of-the- art methadone clinic in Coney Island. Burke looks pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not just talking a run-of-the- mill clinic... I'm going to build a methadone palace. A place where men and women can withdraw in luxury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheldon, you can't do an ice show and cut out the vendors. And more importantly, you can't cut out the Parade of Hope. It's suicide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always told me, when you've got muscles you make the rules. Well, I'm feeling pretty strong right now. Sheldon rises and tosses his napkin down. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this time I was letting the business use me. Well, I think it's time I start using the business. I've got my clout back and I'm not gonna waste it this time. Take care of it, Burke. Sheldon exits.    Burke sits there, looking very concerned. On his way out the door, Tommy stops Sheldon.       Spinner's COWBELL CLANGING continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shel, you gotta help me out. He bangs that goddamn thing from morning till night. I got a headache that goes from my eyes to my ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever I can do, Tommy, just say it. You know I love Spinner. And I owe you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give the boy something else to do on the show. Anything. Just as long as it don't clang, chime or honk. INT. STOKES' OFFICE - TIGHT ON FACE OF FRANK STOKES - DAY frightened.    There's a gun to his temple. WIDER Chick, the Asian representative of Takashi, holds a revolver on Stokes. His cohorts, Sambo and Tobi, stand by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like complications, Frank. You got one week to get Takashi that slot or you're gonna be shakin' hands with Buddha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you understand? My hands are tied. The rhino's been exonerated. The show's more popular than ever. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Sambo and Tobi) Okay, boys, chop him up, bag him and dump him in the woods. Sambo and Tobi start to advance on Stokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right! I'll take care of it! I just need time! Chick leans into Stokes' face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One week, Jeeves. Got that? Or I get a blender and make an Orange Julius with your feet. They exit. EXT. STREET - DAY A down-and-out Randolph shuffles along in ratty bedroom slippers. He passes a MAN who sits behind a small table on the sidewalk. The table has a huge photograph of a rhinoceros taped in front of it. Literature and pamphlets depicting the black rhino are spread out on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save the rhino! Before it's too late! Make a donation! Save the rhino! (to Randolph) Hey, mister, ya wanna help save the rhino? Randolph just looks at him for a moment. He looks at all the rhino-related imagery. He starts shaking and suddenly jumps over the table and attacks the Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the one who needs to be saved! Me. I'm broke! I lost my lawyer! My only friend kicked me out! I'm a fucking peanut shell in the shape of a man! Save the Rainbow! Save the Rainbow! Save the Rainbow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help!   Someone call a cop! Randolph grabs the collection can and runs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. CENTRAL PARK - DAY It's a chilly, grey afternoon. Stokes and Burke walk along the lake framed by the New York skyline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your client is suffocating me. To make matters worse, he's caused me to veer into a hazardous situation. A situation that otherwise could have a very happy ending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me more about the Asians.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're ruthless. Unwavering. Unprincipled. And best of all, they know how the game is played. They respect our delicate ecosystem of mutual benefit. Stokes stops walking and grabs Burke's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd bring you in on this, Burke. You'd be my partner on the Takashi deal. Split down the middle. We have an opportunity to get back on track here. Back to the way it was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The good old days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pre-rhinoceros. The two men look at each other as thoughts pass silently between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is very sticky ground we're about to walk on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you're used to a little glue on your shoes. Burke smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me poke around. Sift through the possibilities. OMITTED
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ALLEY OFF ND STREET - THEATER STAGE DOOR - EVENING A slender young man in a Peter Pan costume in being held by a big thug as another thug beats him up. A girl dressed as Tinkerbell (also being restrained) looks on in horror. Merv Green (Parade of Hope) steps INTO FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what happens to guys who keep secrets, Johnny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you the rest next week! I promise!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not me you're fucking over, it's sick kids. You got something against sick kids, Johnny? The thug punches him in the stomach again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!   I love sick kids! Merv nods to one of the thugs who releases Peter Pan.   He slumps to the ground. Merv kneels down and lifts his head from the pavement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you tell that fat producer of yours, if he ever gives me a low head count again, he'll lose the other thumb. One of Merv's thugs leans in, whispers something to Merv, who looks up to see. Burke standing in the mouth of the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merv Green. How's tricks, kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if it ain't smilin' Burke. Whose bones are you pickin' today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckles) You got a minute, pally? OMITTED
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ND STREET - MOMENTS LATER Burke and Merv walk along 42nd Street. A poster advertises Peter Pan "Sponsored by Parade of Hope -- Giving Children the Gift of Promise!" Merv's thugs trail behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one freezes me out of an ice show. No one. I don't care how many fucking clinics he's trying to save.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm chokin' on the same bone as you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're trying to aggravate me, you're doing a hell of a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not here to aggravate, just educate. I think Mopes might be talking to people he shouldn't be talking to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's an ugly string of words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got it in his head that he's gonna clean up the way we do business. (beat) Truthfully? I wouldn't be surprised if he's wearing a wire. Burke looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, I got a thing across town. He steps off the curb to hail a cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's keep talking, Merv. There's oughta be some kind of solution. Don't you think? Burke hops into a cab.   Merv watches the cab pull away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. TIMES SQUARE - OUTSIDE KIDNET BUILDING - TIGHT SHOT - LEGS OF SMALL CARD TABLE - MORNING SNAP open. The table is set on the sidewalk. A man's legs ENTER the FRAME and shakily climb on top of the table. WIDER Randolph stands on the table directly in front of the Kidnet Building. He raises the megaphone to his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attention, New Yorkers! You are about to hear a shocking story of injustice! WIDER Randolph stands on the table directly in front of the Kidnet Building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I urge you to listen! It has a surprise ending you won't want to miss! A crowd starts to form on the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the story of a venomous rhino and his aggressive campaign to slander, vilify, defame, denigrate and villainize my good name! But one thing he can't do, is take my life from me. No, friends, only I have the power to do that! He reaches down and picks up a can of gasoline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what Smoochy has done to me! He's brought me to this! I can no longer live in a world where the innocent suffer and the wicked thrive! Randolph raises the can over his head and pauses dramatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is God??!! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He drenches himself with gasoline. The crowd grows larger. He holds up a pack of matches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to do this, people. Don't try to talk me out of it. The crowd starts to applaud.     Randolph looks baffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it!   Light it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our guest of honor will be here any moment! This is for his eyes! For his conscience. He'll have to live with this imagine for the rest of his miserable life! INT. LIMO - CONTINUOUS ACTION Sheldon sits in the back of a limo on his way to work, reading the paper. The headline blares: "SMOOCHY ANNOUNCES ICE SHOW AT GARDEN." The subhead reads: "ALL PROCEEDS TO BENEFIT BROOKLYN CLINIC."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to driver) Take it from me, Lester. Use your power. Don't squander it -- build with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sound advice, Mr. Mopes. If I ever get any power I'll give that a whirl. (notices crowd up ahead) Hey, what's going on up there? Sheldon glances up from his paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (casually) Looks like a street performer of some sort. He goes back to his paper. EXT. TIMES SQUARE - CONTINUOUS ACTION Randolph sees the Kidnet limo approaching. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it, folks! It's showtime! I'm sorry to do this, but he's left me no choice! Randolph tries to light another match, but it's wet from the gasoline. The crowd laughs and starts taunting him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, you hillbilly assholes! You're borough trash! Go back to your huts across the river! Randolph keeps trying to light the match. Finally, after several attempts, it lights. He holds it up. The crowd burst into applause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you! Fuck all you people! I was the last of the Mohicans! You'll never see another Rainbow Randolph in this lifetime! You had me and you blew it! All of you! He turns and faces the approaching limousine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This if for you, Smoochy! Remember this! As long as you live, remember this image! You did this to me! He brings the match closer to his gasoline-soaked body. The limo continues to approach. The crowd taunts him to do it. He tries to bring the match closer, but his hand is shaking. Suddenly, a LITTLE GIRL pushes through the crowd. Everyone quiets down as she looks up at Randolph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatcha doin', Rainbow Randolph? Randolph freezes as he looks down at the Little Girl. A slight look of hope comes over his face. She smiles sweetly at him, walks over, and blows out the match. Randolph is overcome with emotion. Just then, Sheldon's LIMO WHOOSHES past him. The crowd cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoochy!!! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: They all run away from Randolph and over to Sheldon's limo as it pulls in front of the Kidnet Building. Randolph stares at them blankly. He looks down. The Little Girl is gone. Sheldon gets out of the limo. The crowd cheers him as he waves to them before going inside. A look of utter frustration now comes over Randolph. OVERHEAD SHOT Randolph drops to his knees on the table, looks skyward, and screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does it all mean??!! The CAMERA RISES ABOVE him as he lets out an anguished howl that REVERBERATES through the skyscrapers. INT. KIDNET STUDIOS - BACKSTAGE - TIGHT ON DISAPPOINTED FACE OF SPINNER DUNN - DAY SPINNER What do you mean I can't play the cowbell no more? WIDER Sheldon gently tries to break the news to Spinner who's on the verge of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're too talented for the cowbell, Spinner. Cowbells are for babies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a little angry) I ain't no baby!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. You're a fully grown man. With whiskers... and scars... the whole sha-bang. That's why you deserve a bigger role on the show. A more important role... Spinner's face starts to perk up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. STUDIO C - SHORT WHILE LATER It's the middle of a Smoochy taping. Smoochy and the Gang are wrapping up a song entitled, "My Stepdad's Not Mean (He's Just Adjusting.)" The kids in the bleachers are singing the chorus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Stepdads are people too/ They have bad days, like we all do/ Be patient and help them through/ Stepdads are people too...' Smoochy continues the song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (singing) ... 'So three cheers for the man that I proudly call Stan... He's not quite a dad or a brother... Yes, he gets cross, but still he's the boss... And besides he takes care of my mother!' The song ends. The kids in the bleachers applaud. Smoochy addresses them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember, kids. First impressions, good or bad, are not always what they seem. Just like a new puppy, new dads need to adjust to their surroundings. So give 'em time! But always remember... if he becomes abusive to you or Mommy... what are the magic numbers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting in unison) Nine-One-One!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right-o-riffic! The Smoochyland Band plays a little fanfare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now, boys and girls, I have a special surprise. I'd like to introduce the newest member of the Magic Jungle... my cousin... Moochy the Rhino! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The Smoochyland Band plays a happy little song as Spinner Dunn, in costume as Moochy, runs on stage. The Moochy costume is identical to Smoochy only it's a darker orange instead of bright orange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howdy, Moochy! Welcome to the Jungle! You wanna say howdy to the kids? Spinner freezes.       He stares at the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moochy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Moochy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. We've established that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (leaning into Sheldon) Sheldon, this costume's makin' my nuts itch. Sheldon looks horrified. The Smoochyland Band quickly launches into some music. Smoochy, Moochy and a few other jungle animals begin to dance. Moochy's lumbering movements are in stark contrast to the choreographed steps of the others. As a bonus, he occasionally scratches his crotch. INT. SHELDON'S DRESSING ROOM - AFTER THE SHOW A happy Spinner (still in costume as Moochy) pokes his head into Sheldon's dressing room. Sheldon, still in costume as well, looks drained after the difficult taping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was fun! Was it bad when I done that thing, where I tripped and knocked over the Flamingo and then he knocked over the cameraman and then those lights fell down on that lady's head? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine, Spinner. We'll edit it out. But tomorrow in rehearsal we're gonna work on a new thing called 'the importance of hitting your mark.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great!    I get to hit something! Spinner dances off. A beat later, Nora enters and shuts the door. There's an awkward beat of silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I read about the ice show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, the papers seem to be really covering it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's great. What you're doing for that clinic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. She nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just need some clarification...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. Spinner just needs a little more rehearsal. I'll get him there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I mean about us. Sheldon looks uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever since you've been back I just feel like there's something that's not connecting. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'm still readjusting a little. Like a guy who's come back from the war. Not that I'd equate my misfortune with the brave men and women who protect us overseas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just thought we were on our way to something... granted, my mistaken belief that you had ties to Neo-Nazis might have put a damper on our relationship, but I'm sorry for -- Sheldon suddenly jumps up and grabs her. He kisses her passionately. Nora immediately starts ripping off his costume as they make out. They fall to the floor in a lustful embrace. INT. STUDIO - BACK HALLWAY - SAME TIME Spinner, humming to himself, lumbers down the hallway on his way to the wardrobe room. Halfway down the hall, he hears a voice call out to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- rhino. Spinner turns around. The door to the fire exit swings open. Two of Merv's thugs emerge and grab Spinner (who's still in full Moochy costume) and drag him into the stairwell. INT. UNDERGROUND PARKING GARAGE - MOMENT LATER Spinner is dragged into the garage and knocked to the pavement. Several more thugs emerge from the shadows, including Henry, Merv's main henchman. They start beating him with lead pipes. Henry pulls out a REVOLVER. He SHOOTS the rhino several times. A sedan trunk is popped open and Moochy is thrown inside. The CAR SCREECHES up to the street. INT. CHINATOWN - NIGHT We CRANE DOWN FROM a Chinese banner that stretches across two tenements. We LAND ON the seedy, deserted street below as the SEDAN BARRELS INTO FRAME and SQUEALS to a stop. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Two thugs emerge from the car. They pull Spinner/Moochy from the trunk and toss his body by some garbage cans, knocking a few over. They get back in the car and speed away. Moochy's lifeless foam body rolls into the gutter and lays motionless. Blood seeps through his foamy torso. LOW OVERHEAD SHOT of Spinner/Moochy. We SLOWLY START TO RISE UP as we LOOK DOWN AT the rhino's body. The WIND WHISTLES through the empty street as we get HIGHER. The Chinese banner rustles THROUGH the FRAME. As we get HIGHER AND HIGHER, we hear the intermittent CLANG of a PRIZE FIGHT BELL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Former heavyweight contender and restaurateur Lawrence 'Spinner' Dunn was found shot to death in a rhinoceros outfit early this morning in Chinatown. Dunn, a frequent performer on 'Smoochy's Magic Jungle,' was pronounced dead at the scene. Police are searching for -- A hand ENTERS FRAME and violently slaps the TV OFF. WIDE An enraged Merv Green glares at his henchmen, Henry and MITCH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you hit the wrong rhino?! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knew Smoochy had a cousin Moochy? They look fucking identical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoochy is bright orange, Moochy is burnt rust! Read the papers! Do I gotta take you back to fucking kindergarten?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All you said was 'hit the rhino.' You never specified the color. I'm not taking the blame for this one. Merv's anger builds. He turns to a picture of Smoochy which is tacked to a bulletin board along with other kid show personalities that the foundation extorts. Merv picks up a letter opener and violently thrusts it into the picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not through with you yet, rhino! Your time will fucking come! INT. ANGELO'S APARTMENT - SHORT WHILE LATER Cops rummage through Angelo's apartment. In the b.g., a detective, ELLIS, interviews Angelo. Another detective, McCALL, is looking through some papers he found. McCALL Ellie, over here. Ellis walks over. McCall shows him some scribblings he's found in a notebook of Randolph's. The crude drawings depict Smoochy with his head cut off... with a knife in his heart... being pissed on by Randolph, etc. "Die, Rhino, Die" is scrawled hundreds of times, filling page after page. The two detectives look at each other and nod. INT. SPINNER DUNN'S RESTAURANT - DAY Spinner sleeps forever in an open casket, clutching his cowbell. Dozens of Spinner's relatives are at the wake. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: A bagpipe player plays "Amazing Grace." Sheldon stands at the casket, fighting back tears as he stares down at his old friend. Nora has her arm around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my fault. He'd still be alive if it wasn't for me. He would have been so proud to be in the ice show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was nothing you could have done. Don't torture yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Spinner.   I'm so sorry. Tommy and the boys walk over. Tommy puts his arm around Sheldon as he gazes somberly at Spinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He really loved you, Shel. And this I guarantee -- that fucking Randolph has seen his last rainbow. We're gonna find him, cut off his balls, and shove 'em up his ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you better leave it to the police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They won't do the ball thing. It's against procedure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't forget -- that hit was meant for you, Shel. So from now on, everywhere you go, we go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay, Tommy.   I'll be fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, nothin'. And as Christ is my witness, no one's touchin' a hair on your fuckin' head. Spinner would have wanted it that way. Tommy's crew nods and agrees. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the boys) Alright, boys, let's get shit- faced. For Spin. They head for the bar.    Nora and Sheldon look down at Spinner in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't Rickets the Hippo have a song about death?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'The Last Nappy Time.' It gave me a lot of comfort when my mother died. (sings quietly) 'When doggies stop barking And fish cease to swim And Grandpa lays silent, from his head to his limbs Sadness will find you But soon you'll feel fine...' Sheldon joins in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'In life we all have Our Last Nappy Time.' Sheldon looks at her.    They embrace as BAGPIPE MUSIC SWELLS. OMITTED EXT. TIMES SQUARE - NIGHT The news zipper in Times Square glides through the night air: "MANHUNT UNDERWAY FOR RAINBOW RANDOLPH... SUSPECTED IN BOXER'S MURDER... SEEN OUTSIDE BUILDING SHORTLY BEFORE SHOOTING, DRENCHED IN GASOLINE AND ACTING PECULIAR..." We CRANE DOWN FROM the zipper ONTO the sidewalk. Randolph is talking on a pay phone. We hear Angelo on the other end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't do it! I know you're still mad at me, but you gotta believe me. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The papers say you were the mastermind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mastermind? I can barely figure out how to unzip my pants these days. Just taking a piss is a logistical nightmare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe you, Randy. But you can't come back to my place. They'll find you. You gotta go underground. EXT. LIBERTY FLOUR AND BISCUIT FACTORY - NIGHT We are outside the long-abandoned Liberty Biscuit and Flour factory. The Liberty sign with its Statue of Liberty logo is eroded and partially missing. INT. LIBERTY BISCUIT AND FLOUR FACTORY - CONTINUOUS ACTION Inside the massive dormant factory, rats scurry around and pigeons occasionally fly from window sill to window sill. A makeshift living area has been set up in the middle of it all -- a chair, lamp, small table, hot plate, etc. Randolph lays on the dilapidated conveyor belt, huddled under a blanket. Angelo enters the factory through a rusty door, carrying provisions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's heatin' up out there. Every cop in New York is looking for you. And Tommy Cotter's boys are combin' the streets. You're gonna have to stay put for a while. Randolph sits up on the conveyor belt, blanket draped over his shoulders. He's a physical and emotional wreck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was an altar boy once. Did you know that? I wanted to be a priest. Do you believe in angels, Angie? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Angels?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a little angel in pigtails. She was the only one who cared about me. She saved my life. Angelo hops up on the conveyor belt to console Randolph. Randolph rests his head on Angelo's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't want to kill yourself, Randy. You know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps it's time to heal. To accept the fact that Smoochy has won and gracefully march forward. True, I'm currently wanted for a murder I didn't commit. But I have faith. Faith that justice will prevail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you're talkin', kid. This is a big step... I'm proud of you. He strokes Randolph's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you bring lunch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chicken and stars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like you asked for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have some, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a smile. Randolph sniffs and manages a small pitiful smile. Angelo musses his hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Atta boy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Angelo lifts one of the grocery bags onto the conveyor belt.
direction.name: direction

Randolph reaches into the bag and pulls out a copy of the New York Post. The lead article's headline reads, "WAKE FOR SPINNER." A large photograph shows mourners leaving the restaurant after the wake. Clearly visible are Sheldon and Nora. They have their arms around each other. Randolph's eyes widen. He starts to hyperventilate. Angelo looks up.

direction.raw_text: You okay? Randy? Finally, Randolph expels a blood-curdling scream that ECHOES through the factory.

direction.raw_text: Motherfucker!!!!!!! Angelo drops the soup.      Birds in the factory flutter from the rafters. INT. MADISON SQUARE GARDEN - ICE RINK Sheldon and the Rhinettes work on some choreography for that night's show. Nora watches from the sidelines. As Sheldon skates on the ice rink, Merv enters with Roy and Danny. Sheldon skates over to them. Nora walks over, too.

direction.raw_text: Big news, Shel.

direction.raw_text: It wasn't Smiley who killed Spinner. It was Parade of Hope.

direction.raw_text: We did our own investigation. Cousin Ian from down at the morgue... you met him at the wake... FLASHBACK - INT. SPINNER DUNN'S - DAY Tommy is at the bar listening intently to a man, IAN, who is pointing to certain details on a photograph.

direction.raw_text: See the neck? Snapped like a twig. Animals... Parade of Hope's calling card. When they do a guy, they like to sign the tab.

direction.raw_text: It was a mistake! An honest mistake! All I'm trying to do is help children.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) No... no... no! He SCREAMS. We hear the sound of the HATCHET HITTING its target. Merv's pleading stops.

STOKES' OFFICE - EVENING Nora is alone in Stokes' office, rearranging cards on the giant cork board that displays the network schedule. She is startled to hear a deep voice behind her.

direction.raw_text: Where is he? She turns around. Chick, Tobi, and Sambo are standing there. Chick walks over to the cork board. He scans a row of cards that all read "Smoochy."

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about and your cologne's making me nauseous. Other than that, you're great company. Chick looks at his boys and chuckles.

direction.raw_text: Spicy little thing, isn't she? (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Takashi gets that time slot. You hear me, girly? Tell that boss of yours we'll kill everyone at this fucking network if we have to. Starting with the pretty ones. He removes the knife from her throat and hurls it toward the bulletin board. It lands -- sticking right in the middle of a Smoochy card.

direction.raw_text: Auf Wiedersehen, honey. They exit. INT. SHELDON'S PENTHOUSE - NIGHT Nora is pacing.    Sheldon sits by the fire.

direction.raw_text: Jesus, Sheldon! Don't you ever pick up a copy of International Performer? He's the hottest kid show host from Asia. Sheldon's head is swimming. Suddenly the front door to to the penthouse bursts open. Randolph, dressed like he's about to do his old show, stumbles in waving a gun. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah! How very cozy. Like two logs in a little bonfire. All we need is a few sticks and some wienies. He almost trips as he stumbles over to Sheldon.      He waves the gun in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had her before you! Pachyderm! I was in love with her! In love! And you snatched her away! Like a common thief! You're the bad guy! Not me! He's the bad guy, Nora. He's incapable of understanding the love we once had! Tender, yet passionate. Old-fashioned, yet experimental. (cackles) Tell him about a few of our experiments, Nora! Tell him! Sheldon looks stunned.    Nora hangs her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this true? Please tell me it's just the confused ramblings of a diseased mind. She looks at him, but doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy mother of Toledo. When exactly were you planning to let me know about this?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, there was a time -- and I'm not proud of this -- but there was a time when I was a bit of a... kiddie-host groupie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just another action figure for her collection!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not fair!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him about Jingle Jackson! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dated Jingle Jackson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bells turned her on. Hey, tell him about Jumbo Johnny! There's a tale for ya! A whale of a tale! She looks down, somewhat ashamed.      A look of utter shock comes over Sheldon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh good Lord in Heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, what I did before I met you is none of your business.

direction.raw_text: Shut up!   Both of you! This is my show! He waves the gun threateningly as he backs up to an armchair and sits down.

direction.raw_text: Do you fully understand the power of a condemned man? Do you? I'm already wanted for one murder, why should I give a flaming horse's twat if I commit two more?

direction.raw_text: ... uh... read once that the best way to diffuse a tense situation is with a little humor. To that end, would you like to hear a funny joke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, please. Go blow yourself, Martha. (waves gun again) Fix me a beverage, woman. Make me one of those drinks that used to make us all warm and fuzzy before bouncy-bouncy time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fix it yourself, asshole. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember, I have Mr. Boomy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you, you'd love this joke. It revolves around Santa Claus and the Easter Bunny getting into a fender bender. Nora rolls her eyes and goes to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, when I lived here I used to have a big painting above the fireplace. A naked chick holding a pumpkin. It was very tasteful. No bush...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Randolph. We know it wasn't you who killed Spinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll go to the police, first thing tomorrow... straighten everything out.

direction.raw_text: Oh!  Goody-goody gumdrops! (to Nora) Vodka straight up is fine, sugar babe! He grabs the bottle out of her hand. He rises from the chair. He takes a CD, "PARTY TIME WITH RAINBOW RANDOLPH," from his pocket and puts it into an audio system on the fireplace wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you put on a little weight, honey? That's okay, you're still a hot little brood mare. I bet you miss the sweet sting of my riding crop. Giddy up, pony! The THEME SONG from his show starts to PLAY. He flicks a switch and a spotlight goes on. He sings and dances. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to tune of 'Ol' MacDonald) 'Rainbow Randolph is the man. Yes he, yes he, is. He's the Prez of Rainbowland. Yes he, yes he, is. With some fun, fun here, and a laugh, laugh there. Here a dance, there a song, Everything is fun, fun. Rainbow Randolph is the King, the King of Rainbowland!' Randolph takes another drink from the vodka bottle. Sheldon suddenly lunges at Randolph and tries to grab the gun. Randolph shrieks. The two men wrestle on the floor, but Randolph is not much of a fighter. He screams as Sheldon rolls him toward the fireplace.

direction.raw_text: Is this what you want? A Hansel and Gretel ending?! You want to be the big bad wolf?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! It's too hot!    The heat! It's driving me mad! Randolph rolls Sheldon to the bottom. Nora reaches for a fireplace poker and whacks Randolph with it. Randolph cries out and drops the gun. Sheldon grabs it and points it at Randolph who lies on the floor, blubbering like a child. He's bleeding.

direction.raw_text: Go ahead, kill me! Finish me off. My life's over anyway. Everything I touch turns to shit. Put me out of my misery. Sheldon slowly takes the gun away from Randolph's head.

direction.raw_text: You're not nothing. You're bitter, misguided and I'm guessing a raging alcoholic, but you're still Rainbow Randolph. Despite everything that's happened, you once made children happy. Randolph sits up and looks at Sheldon through watery eyes. (CONTINUED)

SHELDON'S FOYER - TIGHT ON REVOLVER - SHORT WHILE LATER being loaded. WIDER Sheldon loads his gun as Randolph is curled up on the couch like a little puppy. Nora hands him a cup of tea.

direction.raw_text: Relax, everything's gonna work out.

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Burke... this whole thing... A shadow falls across their table.    Burke looks up.

MADISON SQUARE GARDEN - CONTINUOUS ACTION Ushers, costumed as Rhinettes, help people to their seats. People mull about the concession stands which are adorned with signs that read: "Complimentary Apple Slices!" "Have a Salt-Free Pretzel!" "Enjoy a Soy Dog on Smoochy!" "Fresh Squeezed O.J. -- Have a Glass!" "Sugar Free Brownies -- They're Not as Bad as they Sound!" "Free! Everything is Free!" "Keep Your Wallet in Your Pocket!" "Friendship is More Important than Money!" INT. ANGELO'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Angelo's place looks like a cyclone hit it. Angelo works free from the ropes that have bound his wrists. He has been hit over the head and is groggy as he reaches for the phone. INT. SHELDON'S PENTHOUSE - CONTINUOUS ACTION A freshly showered Randolph is wearing Sheldon's robe and has a pink towel wrapped around his head as he lounges on the living room sofa. He's eating grapes and reading National Geographic. The PHONE RINGS. He picks it up.

direction.raw_text: (sing-songy) Hellooo! We GO TO a SPLIT-SCREEN with Angelo.

direction.raw_text: Listen, Buggy's been here.

direction.raw_text: Buggy Double D's?   The Dong Man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he lifted my backstage pass and he's braggin' that he's doing some kind of job for Burke Bennett. Randolph thinks.    He suddenly looks very worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheldon's in trouble.   I gotta get down to the Garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place is crawling with cops. They'll jump on you like a trampoline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. He rips the towel from his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to warn the rhino. INT. MADISON SQUARE GARDEN - BASEMENT Buggy, in his ill-fitting Rhinette costume, emerges from the sub-basement carrying a thin suitcase. As far as anyone's concerned, he's just another usher. He heads for the stairwell. INT. MADISON SQUARE GARDEN - CONTINUOUS ACTION Every seat in the arena is occupied. The lights are lowered. A slow rolling TYMPANY is heard. After a moment, the Rhinettes skate out to enthusiastic applause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACKSTAGE Sheldon, looking very intense, stands alone in the wings. He takes a couple of deep breaths. We TILT DOWN and see the bulge of the revolver under his Smoochy costume. ICE RINK The Rhinettes have formed a line across the middle of the rink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now... it gives us great pleasure to introduce America's favorite rhino... ladies and gentlemen... boys and girls... (dramatic pause) Heeeeere's Smoochy! Smoochy skates out to thunderous applause. The entire arena is on its feet. The Rhinettes part as Smoochy skates through them and stops in the middle of the rink. The applause and cheering don't stop for several moments. One of the Rhinettes hands Smoochy a microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On behalf of myself, the Rhinettes, and the soon to be restored Coney Island Methadone Center, I thank you all for coming. NETWORK BOX Burke and Stokes roll their eyes. BACK ON SHELDON SMOOCHY It was my original intention that tonight's performance would be a benign mix of Smoochy songs and ice dancing. But as an artist, I believe I must convey to you, my fans, what I'm feeling at any given moment in my life. To do otherwise would be dishonest. Art is communication. It's something we learn and hopefully grow from. With that in mind... I hope you enjoy the show. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: More applause as Smoochy skates over to the Rhinettes. They form a circle around him and slap hands in solidarity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for Spinner. The lights go down. A full orchestra begins to play the overture to WAGNER's Tristen et Isolde. The lights come up as a soprano -- a heavyset woman in a modified rhino costume -- skates out through the fog and begins singing the opera. Smoochy -- now wearing a peasant's frock -- skates an interpretive dance in the b.g. with a few Rhinettes who are also dressed as peasants. A beautiful fairy princess floats down (on filament wire) from the rafters and takes Smoochy's hand. She skates away with him as he waves good-bye to the Rhinettes. HIGH ANGLE LOOKING DOWN AT the opera. The CAMERA PANS OVER TO the catwalk high above the rink. CATWALK Buggy Ding-Dong, still in his Rhinette costume, settles into his assassin's roost. He begins to assemble the rifle and check the scope. EXT. MADISON SQUARE GARDEN - FEW MINUTES LATER Randolph emerges from a cab and runs through the crowd outside the Garden. A few people recognize him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Rainbow Randolph!   Someone stop him! Randolph finds a side exit and slips into the arena. INT. MADISON SQUARE GARDEN - FEW MINUTES LATER The "Opera on Ice" continues. The soprano continues singing as Smoochy reenacts the incidents of his recent life. The fairy princess brings Smoochy to a room with a gleaming white desk. Smoochy takes a seat behind the desk. The fairy princess places a crown on his head, bids him good-bye, and floats away. Smoochy sits proudly in his new world. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Suddenly, Rhinettes dressed as devils glide in and skate in a circle around the desk. They throw money at Smoochy. He jumps up and skates away, but the Rhinette devils pursue him with daggers. The music from the orchestra intensifies as the drama plays out. NETWORK BOX Nora continues to watch the opera, totally entranced. Stokes and Burke look a little on edge. Burke glances at his watch. CATWALK Buggy finishes loading the rifle. He shines the barrel with his sleeve and looks through the scope as Smoochy and company continue to perform below. POV THROUGH RIFLE SCOPE Atmospheric fog created by the smoke machine is so thick that Buggy has difficulty FINDING Sheldon THROUGH the cross-hairs. Occasionally, Smoochy skates through a hole in the clouds only to disappear again. BUGGY CURSES in frustration. ARENA Randolph pushes his way past Garden security and runs toward the rink. Several cops working the event spot him. A few spectators scream in horror. ICE RINK The soprano's mournful aria reaches its crescendo as Smoochy is now pursued by Rhinettes dressed as Nazis. They hold signs with words like "SCANDAL" and "SHAME." Smoochy skates to a section of the rink resembling Chinatown where he lands over a fallen "Moochy." He cradles Moochy's head in his arms as the Nazis glide past him and disappear into the fog. NETWORK BOX Nora wipes a tear from her eye as she watches the tragedy play out. Burke and Stokes glance skyward. Nora notices this. 112. RINK'S EDGE Randolph reaches the rink as cops push their way toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheldon!!! But Sheldon can't hear over the orchestra.   The soprano hits a high note. CATWALK Buggy aims the rifle. POV THROUGH RIFLE SCOPE Smoochy glides THROUGH the cross-hairs followed by a Rhinette. TIGHT ON BUGGY'S FINGER as he quickly squeezes off a SHOT. RINK The MUFFLED sound of GUNSHOT is absorbed by the intense music. A wounded Rhinette falls to the ice, but no one notices. Smoochy, oblivious, continues to skate toward the "gates of heaven" with the angel Moochy. Giant white gates slowly swing open at the rink's far end as floating angels open their arms to welcome Moochy. OUTER RINK Randolph runs around the rink's perimeter, trying to get Sheldon's attention. Cops and security push their way towards Randolph. He suddenly notices the felled Rhinette on the ice and looks skyward. He can make out a rifle barrel protruding from the catwalk. NETWORK BOX Stokes and Burke notice a commotion in the audience. They now see Randolph running through the crowd on his way to the stairwell. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering to Burke) What's he doing here?! He's going to screw everything up! Nora notices the distressed look on their faces and follows their gaze to the rafters. She now sees the rifle barrel. ANGLE - NORA jumps to her feet.      FAST PUSH IN TO Nora's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (screaming) Sheldon!!! She starts to climb out of the box but Burke stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nora...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in on this, aren't you! You sold him out! You fucking snake! Stokes tries to put his arm around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nora, please. It's not what you think. I'm grooming you. You're going to run the division one day... She pushes him. He goes down hard. She starts to climb out of the box. Burke tries to grab her, but she spins around and punches him. She runs for the rink. Stokes stands in the box looking dumbstruck as pande- monium plays out around him. People are running in all directions, cops are everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frightened; to Burke) What now? What do we do now?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Survival of the fittest! Burke runs off through the panicked crowd. Stokes looks around and heads off in the opposite direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OUTSIDE RINK Tommy and her boys notice the commotion in the audience. They see cops pursuing someone. They realize it's Randolph. Tommy, Jimmy and Sammy take off after him. CATWALK Buggy, in position again, looks through the rifle scope. POV THROUGH RIFLE SCOPE As the soprano reaches for an impossibly high note, the fog dissipates slightly and Smoochy's foam rubber head COMES perfectly INTO VIEW. BUGGY smiles. RINK'S EDGE Nora screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheldon!!! Get down!!! CLOSE ON BUGGY'S FINGER He's about to squeeze the trigger. CATWALK Randolph reaches the catwalk as the orchestra plays a dramatic series of smashing notes. He tackles Buggy just as he squeezes off the SHOT. RINK The top of Smoochy's foam rubber head is blown off. In SLOW MOTION, Smoochy's tattered horn sails through the air and lands softly on the ice. WIDE Everyone in the arena screams and heads for the exits. It's pandemonium. Thanks to Randolph, Buggy's shot was too high and just missed Sheldon's skull. (CONTINUED)
